title: 820-3787 works fine and then randomly crashes
message:
I went to youtube and saw this video

[MEDIA=youtube]_QC_KcnPQmE[/MEDIA]

Bought the 3 MOSFETS and went to replace it. However when removing the last one on the top right. I actually removed the middle ground pad. Not a bad thing but made me resolder it again 3 times. I think now its perfectly working.

The problem is that I actually melted by accident the component right besides it L9360, which I also do not have the same from my donor boards. Is it possible to use another component?

I do have donor boards of the 820-2936 / 820-3115 / 820-3023 / 820-3024 / 820-4668

Images attached below for better reference

title: 820-3787 works fine and then randomly crashes
message:
L9360 should be good, if machine works.
Can you post a picture of damage?

title: 820-3787 works fine and then randomly crashes
message:
I completely destroyed it and actually removed from the board totally broken thats why I need another one.

Can I get a different one from the boards that I do have?

title: 820-3787 works fine and then randomly crashes
message:
Find similar one, 0.2uH/24A/30mOhm; more or less equal.
I recommend you to change both GPU coils, with identical model.

title: 820-3787 works fine and then randomly crashes
message:
Got it

But If I do get the same one from the same donor board I only need to put back the one I removed right?

title: 820-3787 works fine and then randomly crashes
